content: The Louvre Museum, one of the world's largest art museums and a historic monument, is located in which city?

The Louvre Museum is located in Paris, the capital city of France. It's situated on the Right Bank of the Seine River, in the 1st arrondissement of the city. The museum is housed in the Louvre Palace, which was originally built as a fortress in the late 12th century under Philip II. Over the centuries, it has been expanded and renovated multiple times, and it now serves as a major cultural institution and a symbol of French history and art.
